Mr. PADILLA. I thank the Presiding Officer.

Mr. PADILLA. Mr. President, I wonder if any other Member of this  Chamber grew up like I did where on a pretty regular basis, we would be  sent home from grade school because of…

…2021.

Demonstrating years of leadership and honoring a commitment to serve  the nearly 80,000 residents of Baldwin Park as the city's first  Mexican-American chief executive officer, Mr. Zaldivar paved his own  path to enhance city operations and make our community a better place.

Throughout his tenure, he helped establish the city's Mexican  Consulate…

…RASKIN. Even in the case of a SWAT team, the gentleman is saying  that a member of a SWAT team would not have a semiautomatic weapon?

Mr. RASKIN. Are they not issued to the officer?

Mr. RASKIN. That is while you are an officer. Now let's say you  retire and you commit domestic violence or assault or battery or some  other offense 2 years later. The department…
The PRESIDING OFFICER (Mr. Husted). The Senator from North Carolina.
The PRESIDING OFFICER (Mr. Justice). The majority leader.
The PRESIDING OFFICER (Mr. Justice). The Senator from North Dakota.

The PRESIDING OFFICER (Mr. Justice). On this vote, the yeas are 60,  the nays are 39. The motion is agreed to.

The motion was agreed to.
The PRESIDING OFFICER (Mr. Sheehy). The Senator from California.                                   S. 1071

The PRESIDING OFFICER (Mr. Curtis). The clerk will report the  nomination.

The legislative clerk read the nomination of Emil J. Bove III, of  Pennsylvania, to be United States Circuit Judge for…

The PRESIDING OFFICER (Mr. Hagerty). The Senator from Alabama.
The PRESIDING OFFICER (Mr. Curtis). On this vote, the yeas are 50,  the nays are 44. Three-fifths of the Senate, duly chosen and sworn, not  having voted in the affirmative, the motion is not agreed…

The PRESIDING OFFICER (Mr. Justice). Without objection, it is so  ordered.
